title: 113_s1484
content: The Act is titled the "Sabine National Forest Land Exchange Act of 2013" and includes definitions for various terms used in the Act. The "Sabine National Forest Land Exchange Act of 2013" defines terms such as Authority, Federal land, and Non-federal land. The Authority refers to the Sabine River Authority of Texas, Federal land includes National Forest System land within the Sabine National Forest and Toledo Bend Project boundary, and Non-federal land is land not owned by the federal government. The "Sabine National Forest Land Exchange Act of 2013" defines terms such as Authority, Federal land, Non-federal land, Secretary, Toledo Bend Project, and Wilderness area. The Secretary is the Secretary of Agriculture, the Toledo Bend Project is a Federal Energy Regulatory Commission project, and the Wilderness area is the Indian Mounds Wilderness Area in Sabine National Forest designated by the Texas Wilderness Act of 1984. The term "wilderness area" refers to the Indian Mounds Wilderness Area in Sabine National Forest as designated by the Texas Wilderness Act of 1984. "Wilderness candidate land" is the surface estate of land adjacent to the wilderness area, to be agreed upon by the Authority and the Secretary. SEC. 3. LAND EXCHANGE, SABINE NATIONAL FOREST. In exchange for non-Federal land, wilderness candidate land, and any cash payment, the Secretary will convey all US interests in Federal land subject to existing rights. An appraisal must be completed within 180 days following specific standards. The Secretary will determine the value of Federal land considering restrictions imposed by a covenant. Surveys will identify the land to be exchanged, with costs shared equally. Cash equalization may be involved in the exchange process. The land exchange process involves surveys to identify the land, with costs shared equally between the Authority and the Secretary. Cash equalization may be used to equalize the value of exchanged land, with any payments received deposited into a specific fund for the Secretary's expenditure. The cash equalization payment received by the Secretary is deposited into a specific fund for land acquisition in the National Forest System. Title to non-Federal land conveyed must meet the Secretary's approval and conform to the Attorney General's standards. The deed of conveyance reserves any subsurface mineral estate owned by the United States. The deed of conveyance for Federal land to the Authority must conform to the Attorney General's standards. It reserves any subsurface mineral estate owned by the United States and includes a restrictive covenant for land use. The Authority may operate Forest Service campgrounds on conveyed land, with a restrictive covenant prohibiting commercial, residential, or industrial development. The land exchange should be completed within one year of the Act's enactment. SEC. 4. BOUNDARY ADJUSTMENT, INDIAN MOUNDS WILDERNESS AREA, SABINE NATIONAL FOREST. Boundary Adjustment for the Indian Mounds Wilderness Area in Sabine National Forest involves excluding land within the Toledo Bend Project and adding acquired wilderness candidate land to the wilderness area. The Secretary will modify boundaries accordingly and file a map and legal description with relevant committees after the land exchange is completed. After completing the land exchange, the Secretary will file a map and legal description of the wilderness area boundary changes with the relevant committees for public inspection.
